en: The rehearsal last night went well.
zh: 昨晚的綵排進行得非常順利，一切都沒出什麼岔子。

en: “I do,” Eva said, and the crowd was smiling and some, like Eva’s mother, were weeping.
zh: 「我願意。」伊娃說，眾人都開心地笑了，而有些人，比如伊娃的母親，卻忍不住哭了。

en: Weddings had always made her weep.
zh: 她每次參加婚禮都會哭。

en: “I now pronounce you man and wife,” Father Jacob said, then smiled and looked at Rick.
zh: 「現在，我宣布你們結為夫妻。」雅各布神父微笑著看著瑞克說，「現在你可以親吻你的新娘了。」

en: Rick kissed his bride and the crowd started to clap.
zh: 瑞克親吻他的新娘，眾人開始鼓掌。

en: Everything had gone off without a hitch—even Jerry had walked his daughter down the aisle perfectly, the right pacing, the right smile, the right amount of pressure on her arm as hers interlocked his.
zh: 一切都進行得十分順利，甚至傑瑞挽著女兒走過甬道的那一幕也無可挑剔，有序的步伐、得體的笑容，挽著女兒手臂的力道也剛好。

en: It was a long kiss between the new husband and bride, and people started to laugh, and then the happy couple turned towards the crowd and they smiled.
zh: 新郎和新娘長吻，人們歡笑起來，幸福的情侶微笑著轉向人群。

en: Soon the wedding party was moving down the aisle, people throwing confetti into the air, an usher waiting at the door, and that’s when it happened, the front doors busting open as the zombies piled in, the doors hitting the walls so hard that wood splintered everywhere.
zh: 少頃，這對新人走過甬道，人們紛紛將彩紙屑拋向空中。迎賓員還等候在門口，忽然間前門砰地被打開，重重地撞向牆壁，木屑四濺，一隊從墓地里爬出來的殭屍湧入了教堂。

en: “I do love a good wedding,” the first zombie said.
zh: 「我喜歡精彩的婚禮。」第一個殭屍說。

en: “Brains,” said the second one.
zh: 「真有腦子。」第二個說。

en: “Good point,” replied the first one. “Brains.”
zh: 「說得好，」第一個回答，「真有腦子。

en: Then another said it too, and another, and the word was catching, because soon it was on the lips of all the dead people.
zh: 」然後另一個說，另一個又接著說，好像這個詞真有感染力似的，所有的殭屍都開始如是說了起來。

en: The other things on their lips were the living as the zombies tore into them, and within seconds Eva and Rick were running for their lives. . . .
zh: 接著殭屍開始撲向人群，嘴上說著「活人啊」，下一秒，伊娃和瑞克就開始他們的亡命狂奔了……

en: Thanks, Henry, that’s enough. Don’t give up your day job!
zh: 謝謝你，亨利，這就足夠了，不要放棄你的日常工作！

en: You don’t really think that’s what is waiting for everybody on Saturday, but you can’t shake the feeling something bad is going to happen because it’s been a year of bad feelings, hasn’t it?
zh: 你認為這並不是人們在星期六翹首以盼的，可你無法抑制住厄運當頭的感覺，因為這一年來你心情一直很糟，不是嗎？

en: Both Sandra and Eva are being extremely encouraging, and seem to have a lot more confidence in you than you have.
zh: 桑德拉和伊娃非常樂觀，她們似乎比你自己更有信心。

en: In the church Sandra keeps squeezing your hand and telling you everything is going to go great, and she seems so happy, which makes you happy.
zh: 在教堂桑德拉不斷地握著你的手，告訴你一切都會好起來的。她似乎非常快樂，受到她的感染你也很快樂。

en: Being in the church with your hand in Sandra’s, and your arm around Eva, watching them smile, watching them laugh, it gives you a sense of completion.
zh: 在教堂里，桑德拉握著你的手，伊娃挽著你的胳膊，你看著她們微笑，看著他們哈哈大笑，這足以讓你覺得完滿了。

en: This is the way life is meant to be. Yes, things are going to change, but right now, right in this moment, your family is happy and that’s all that matters.
zh: 這就是生活，是的，什麼都會變的，但就在這一刻，你的家人非常幸福，這才是最重要的。

en: The rehearsal went well. More instructions. Jerry, stand here.
zh: 綵排進行得很順利，他們不斷地下達指令：「傑瑞，站在這裏。」

en: Dad, walk there. Jerry, hold Eva like this.
zh: 「爸爸，走到那裡。」「傑瑞，像這樣挽著伊娃。」

en: You will do nothing if not follow orders.
zh: 要是沒有這些指令，恐怕你什麼也不會做。

en: As for the speech—you don’t get to give one. Of course not, because Pressure Cooker Jerry needs to be contained, and even though that makes you sad, you can understand it.
zh: 至於致辭——你不會致辭，當然不會的，因為「高壓鍋傑瑞」需要加以控制，雖然有點兒難過，但你可以理解。

en: It is, sadly, just the way things are now.
zh: 很可悲，但是事情就是這樣。

en: Oh, by the way, speaking of the way things are now, guess what happens on Monday?
zh: 對了，順便說一句，你猜星期一會發生什麼？

en: That’s right, alarms are being put on the windows.
zh: 非常正確，窗戶上將會安裝警報器。

en: It’s official—soon you’re going to be a prisoner in your own home.
zh: 這是個嚴肅的話題：很快你就會成為自己家裡的囚犯。

en: Good news—the alarms mean Sandra isn’t planning on putting you into a care facility right away.
zh: 好消息：安裝警報器意味著桑德拉不會馬上把你送進療養院。

en: Bad news—your world is getting smaller.
zh: 壞消息：你的世界正不斷崩塌縮小。

en: You don’t really need the alarms now because you don’t even want to go outside.
zh: 你並不需要警報器，因為你現在根本就不想到外面去。

en: You just want to curl up on the couch and drink.
zh: 你只想蜷縮在沙發上，喝上一杯酒。

en: You used to think the difference between being a good author and a great author was . . . ah, hell, you’ve said that already.
zh: 你以前認為好作家和偉大的作家之間的區別是……媽的，你已經說過了。

en: They pull out from the side of the road.
zh: 他們驅車駛離路邊。

en: Jerry plays with the radio until he finds a news channel.
zh: 傑瑞擺弄著收音機，調到了一個新聞頻道。

en: Hans makes the next left to take them towards the center of town.
zh: 漢斯在下一個路口向左轉，駛往市中心。

en: Jerry plays with the label on the water bottle. His legs are still jittering.
zh: 傑瑞把玩著水瓶上的標籤，他的腿仍然在顫抖。

en: “It’s tough, you know?
zh: 「這很難，你知道嗎？

en: Thinking of myself that way,” Jerry says.
zh: 這麼想著我自己。」

en: “Thinking of myself as a killer. It doesn’t feel right. No matter how I try to see it, no matter what angle I come at it from, I can’t get the label to fit.”
zh: 傑瑞說，「想想我自己是殺人兇手，這感覺很怪，不管我怎麼努力想，無論從什麼角度想，也都無法對號入座。」

en: “What happens in your books, Jerry, when people are hoping for the best?”
zh: 「傑瑞，如果人們都渴望幸福的結局的話，在你的書里會有什麼樣的後果？」

en: “They get the worst.”
zh: 「結果都是最糟的。」

en: “I’m sorry, buddy, but that’s what this is.”
zh: 「對不起，老兄，但這就是癥結所在。」

en: Jerry nods. His friend couldn’t have summed it up any better.
zh: 傑瑞點點頭，他的朋友總結得再好不過了。

en: Still . . . “It’s not right.
zh: 只是……「你說得不對。

en: I know what you’re saying makes sense, that there’s a certain kind of logic to it, but it just feels too convenient that I can remember some things but not others.
zh: 我知道你說得在理，也符合邏輯，只是我覺得我可以太容易想起某些事，有些卻不能。

en: Why can’t I remember any of this morning?”
zh: 比如為什麼我不記得今早發生的事呢？」

en: “The doctors say that you blocked out what happened with Sandra, that it’s too difficult for you to accept.
zh: 「醫生說你從內心裡抗拒著發生在桑德拉身上的事，讓你接受實在太難為你了。

en: Stands to reason you’d be doing the same thing now.”
zh: 按理說，你現在也會做同樣的事情。」

en: “I’m not that guy, Hans.
zh: 「我不是那種人，漢斯。

en: I’ve never been that guy.
zh: 我向來不是那種人。

en: I shouldn’t have wiped down the knife. If I’d left it alone, then the real killer’s prints would have been found on it.”
zh: 我不應該擦拭刀柄，但如果我放任不管，警察就會發現真正兇手的指紋。」

en: “It sounds like you were trying to get away with it,” Hans says.
zh: 「這聽起來像是你想逃脫處罰，逍遙法外。」漢斯說。

en: The words annoy him.
zh: 這句話惹惱了他：

en: “It’s not that. I just knew how things looked. That’s why I took the knife to the mall with me.”
zh: 「不是那樣的，我只知道事情的經過，這就是我為什麼把刀拿到商場的原因。」

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “I wasn’t going to dump it there. I just went there to get food and a SIM card.
zh: 「我沒有打算把它扔在那裡，我只是去商場買些吃的和電話卡。

en: I was going to dump it later.”
zh: 我打算過會兒再扔掉。」

en: “You should have called the police.”
zh: 「你應該打電話報警。」

en: “No,” Jerry says.
“I called you because you can help. Because you’ve always been there for me. Because you’re the only person who will believe me.
zh: 傑瑞說，「我打電話給你，因為你可以幫我，因為你一直在我身邊，因為你是唯一相信我的人。

en: When I came out to meet you I realized I’d left the bag with the knife and towel behind in the bathroom.”
zh: 我出來接你時，發現我把裝刀和毛巾的塑料袋落在廁所里了。」

en: “Jesus, Jerry, are you kidding me?
zh: 「天哪，傑瑞，你是在拿我開涮嗎？

en: Or just yourself?
zh: 或者你只是拿你自己開涮？

en: You called me because you think I can help you get away with murder. Just like you did last time.
zh: 你打電話叫我來，只是因為你覺得我可以幫你逃脫法網，就像上一次那樣嗎？

en: Only this time I’m not helping you.”
zh: 只是這一次我不會再幫你了。」

en: Jerry shakes his head. “That’s not true. Somebody wants me to think I’m the Bag Man.”
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭：「這不是真的，有人希望我覺得我自己是『黑袋狂魔』。」

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “The Bag Man. From the books.”
zh: 「『黑袋狂魔』，我小說里的。」

en: Hans shakes his head. “I know who the Bag Man is, Jerry, and you’re not him.”
zh: 漢斯搖搖頭：「我知道誰是『黑袋狂魔』，傑瑞，你不是的。」

en: “I didn’t say I was. I said somebody wants me to think I am.”
zh: 「我沒有說我是，我是說有人希望我覺得我自己是。」

en: “Was the woman this morning killed the way the Bag Man kills?”
zh: 「今天早上被人殺死的那個女孩是按『黑袋狂魔』的手法做的嗎？」

en: Jerry thinks about the woman on the lounge floor, the bruises and the blood. He thinks about her eyes open and staring at him.
zh: 傑瑞回想著那個躺在客廳地板上的女人，她身上的瘀傷和血跡，那雙圓瞪著的盯著他的眼睛。

en: He tries to remember the Bag Man.
zh: 他努力想著「黑袋狂魔」。

en: He can’t remember the who or the why, but he can remember the how.
zh: 他不記得他是誰或者他的殺人動機，但他能記得他的殺人手法。

en: The Bag Man stabbed his victims and when they were dead he tied a plastic garbage bag over their head. He was impersonalizing them.
zh: 「黑袋狂魔」行兇之後會在屍體的頭上套上一個塑料垃圾袋，把他們弄得不像個人。

en: “She was stabbed in the chest. I even had a black garbage bag on me.”
zh: 「她被刺中胸部，而我身上甚至有一個黑色垃圾袋。」

en: “Because you trust yourself.”
zh: 「因為你相信你自己。」

en: “You have to help me.”
zh: 「你一定要幫我。」

en: “Help you how, Jerry?
zh: 「我怎麼幫你，傑瑞？

en: By stealing a detective’s badge and walking around the crime scene asking questions?
zh: 去偷一枚警察徽章，然後到犯罪現場去提問題嗎？

en: Chasing down leads and bending the rules? Pulling a mobile DNA testing kit out of my ass?”
zh: 還是跟蹤線索，變換規則，從我屁股口袋裡拿出一個移動DNA檢測試劑盒？」

en: “No.
zh: 「不是的。

en: Well, yes. I don’t know. Not exactly.
zh: 嗯，是的，我不知道，不完全是。

en: But we can figure it out.”
zh: 但是，我們可以想辦法。」

en: They drive in silence again.
zh: 他們又陷入沉默。

en: The lunchtime traffic is fading as people return to work.
zh: 午餐時間差不多結束了，人們該回去工作了，街上的車流變得稀疏起來。

en: He sees a boy of two or three accidently drop his ice cream on the pavement then start crying, his mother trying fruitlessly to console him.
zh: 他看到一個兩三歲的男孩因為不小心把冰激凌掉在人行道上哭了起來，他的媽媽想安慰他，但徒勞無功。

en: Behind them a bus comes through early on a red light and almost hits a cyclist.
zh: 在他們身後，一輛公共汽車闖了紅燈，差一點兒蹭到一個騎自行車的人。

en: Jerry keeps rewinding the clock, going further back into the morning, but continually comes to a stop the moment he came to on that woman’s couch.
zh: 傑瑞在腦海中撥回指針，他回到了早上，回到在那個女人的沙發上的那一刻，他停了下來。

en: His heart beats harder the closer they get to the police station. When they are two blocks away he’s sweating again.
zh: 他們快到警察局了，他的心跳加快，他們離那兒還有兩個街區遠時他又開始出汗了。

en: “Can we pull over?”
zh: 「我們能停下來嗎？」

en: “We’re almost there,” Hans says.
zh: 「我們快到了。」漢斯說。

en: “Please. Just for a few minutes.
zh: 「拜託，幾分鐘就行。

en: Please, hear me out. As my friend, listen to me.”
zh: 請聽我說完，我的朋友，聽我說。」

en: Hans looks over at him, then indicates and pulls in against the side of the road.
zh: 漢斯打量了他一下，然後做了個手勢，把車停靠在路邊。

en: “Talk,” he says.
zh: 「說吧。」

en: “But you’ve only got a minute.”
zh: 他說，「但你只有一分鐘。」

en: “I didn’t do this,” Jerry says. “My DNA is on record.
zh: 傑瑞說：「不是我乾的，他們系統里有我的DNA樣本。

en: If they’d found my DNA at Belinda’s house, they’d have made the connection.
zh: 他們要是在貝琳達的房子里發現我的DNA，他們早就來找我了。

en: But none was there.”
zh: 但他們沒有。」

en: “You’re a crime writer, Jerry.
zh: 「傑瑞，你是一個犯罪小說家。

en: You know how to commit a crime and get away with it.”
zh: 你知道怎麼犯罪，怎麼逃脫法網。」

en: He remembers Mayor suggesting something very similar on the ride into the police station.
zh: 他還記得在上次去警察局的路上梅厄就做過類似的暗示。

en: “That’s not what happened,” he says.
zh: 「但事情不是那樣的。」他說。

en: “Then you have nothing to worry about.
zh: 「那你還有什麼好擔心的？

en: The police will figure it out.”
zh: 警察會把事情弄清楚的。」

en: “No, they won’t.
zh: 「不，他們不會的，他們會把事情弄得更糟。」

en: He’s not the man he used to be, but he certainly hasn’t gone from crime writing to crime committing.
zh: 他已不是以往的那個他了，不會把犯罪的文字寫作變成真正的實施。

en: “If I go in there and tell them about today, and we tell them about the florist, then it’s going to be like writing a blank check.”
zh: 「如果我去了那裡告訴他們今天發生的事，告訴他們花店老闆的事，那就像給他們開了一張空白支票。」

en: “What are you talking about?”
zh: 「你在說什麼？」

en: “They’re going to take every unsolved homicide over the last few years and they’re going to pin them on me.
zh: 「他們會把幾年間懸而未決的凶殺案全部硬安到我頭上。

en: They’ll probably go back further too. They’re going to say I got sick five years ago. Or ten.
zh: 可能會更離譜，他們會說我是五年前得的病，或十年前得的病。

en: Every open homicide is going to close with my name in the whodunit box.”
zh: 每一起凶殺案都會以我的名字為兇犯結案。」

en: Hans shakes his head. He looks lost in thought. “That’s stupid.”
zh: 漢斯搖搖頭，恍若陷入了沉思：「這麼做太蠢了。」

en: “Is it?
zh: 「是嗎？

en: You really think so?”
zh: 你真的這樣認為嗎？」

en: “They’re not going to take . . .” Hans says, then stops talking.
zh: 「他們不會……」漢斯說，然後頓住不說了。

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: Hans doesn’t look at him. Just keeps looking ahead.
zh: 漢斯沒有看他，而是凝視著前方。

en: A truck passes close enough to the car to make it sway on the axles.
zh: 一輛卡車從轎車身旁駛過，近得差點兒碰到，車身微微搖擺。

en: “What?” Jerry repeats.
zh: 「什麼？」傑瑞重複道。

en: “Nothing.”
zh: 「沒什麼。」

en: “There’s something. Tell me.”
zh: 「一定有什麼事，告訴我。」

en: “It’s nothing,” Hans says.
zh: 「沒什麼。」漢斯說。

en: “Tell me.”
zh: 「告訴我。」

en: Hans breathes out heavily. He sounds like a man who’s cutting wires and hoping a bomb isn’t about to explode.
zh: 漢斯重重地呼出一口氣，聽起來就像他在割斷導火索，盼望著炸彈不會爆炸。

en: “Let me think for a few seconds,” he says.
zh: 「讓我考慮一下。」他說。

en: “Tell me!”
zh: 「告訴我！」

en: “Goddamn it, Jerry, I said let me think.”
zh: 「媽的，傑瑞，我說了讓我先想想。」

en: He thinks.
zh: 他思忖著。

en: And Jerry lets him think. And they stay parked on the side of the road two blocks from the police station, and Jerry stares out the window while his palms sweat and while Hans thinks some more.
zh: 他們停在路邊，離警察局有兩個街區遠，傑瑞凝望著窗外，他的手心在冒汗。

en: Hans tilts his head back and covers his face with his hands. He keeps them there, so the words are muffled when he talks. “There was another killing last week,” he says, then drags his fingers down to his chin, stretching out the skin on his face and tugging down the bottom of his eyes. “It’s still unsolved.
zh: 漢斯陷入了沉思，他歪著頭，雙手捂著臉，保持著這個姿勢一動不動，所以說話時有些含混不清：「上星期也有人被殺害。」

en: A woman by the name of Laura Hunt.”
zh: 「案子仍舊懸而未決，一個名叫勞拉·亨特的女人死了。」

en: “I think I’ve seen it in the papers.”
zh: 「我想我已經在報紙上看到了。」

en: “You can remember that but not this morning?
zh: 「你可以記起來？但不是今天早晨，對不對？

en: I see what you mean about it all seeming convenient.”
zh: 我明白你說太容易想起某些事的意思。」

en: “It’s the exact opposite.”
zh: 「恰恰相反。」

en: “Laura Hunt was twenty-five. She has the same sort of description as Belinda Murray.
zh: 「勞拉·亨特二十五歲，對她的描述與貝琳達·穆雷相同。

en: Eva told me that you wandered last week.
zh: 伊娃告訴我，你上星期也出去漫無目的地遊盪了。

en: It was the same day Laura Hunt was killed.”
zh: 當天，勞拉·亨特就被人殺害了。」

en: Jerry doesn’t know what to say, not at first, but then reverts to what he knows is the absolute truth.
zh: 傑瑞起初不知道該說什麼，但隨後斷定他所知道的絕對是真相。

en: “I didn’t kill her,” he says.
zh: 「我沒有殺她。」他說。

en: “Jerry—” “They found me in the library in town,” he says.
zh: 「傑瑞……」「他們是在市圖書館發現我的。」

en: “If there had been blood on me, I’d have been arrested, but instead the police called Eva and told her to take me back to the nursing home.
zh: 他說，「要是當時我身上有血跡的話，我早被逮捕了。然而，警察只是打電話給伊娃，叫她帶我回到療養院。

en: I didn’t hurt anybody, I promise you.
zh: 我沒有傷害任何人，我向你保證。

en: If you take me to the police, I’ll become the ultimate scapegoat.”
zh: 如果你帶我去警察局，我會成為苦命的替罪羔羊。」

en: “Can you even hear what you’re saying?”
zh: 「你知道你在說什麼嗎？」

en: “You’re supposed to be my friend. You’re supposed to believe me.”
zh: 「你應該是我的朋友，你應該相信我。」

en: “What’s wrong with your arm?”
zh: 「你的胳膊怎麼了？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “You keep scratching it.”
zh: 「你一直在抓你的胳膊。」

en: Jerry looks down to see his fingers digging into the side of his arm.
zh: 傑瑞低頭一看，發現自己的手指正在抓胳膊的一側。

en: If he can scratch an itch on his arm without knowing it, what else is he capable of doing?
zh: 如果他能在自己的手臂上抓一英寸深而渾然不覺，那他還有什麼不能做的？

en: “Nothing’s wrong with it.”
zh: 「沒什麼。」

en: “The cops are going to look at the knife and think somebody was planning on hurting somebody at the mall then changed their mind,” Hans says.
zh: 「警察肯定會查驗那把刀的，他們會認為有人計劃在商場傷人，然後又改變了主意。」漢斯說，「他們會在刀上發現血跡。」

en: “I washed it pretty good.”
zh: 「我沖洗得很乾凈。」

en: “They can always find blood on those things,” Hans says.
zh: 「他們總能在那些東西上面發現血漬的。」

en: What about the bag, Jerry?
zh: 塑料袋呢，傑瑞？

en: Are your prints on the bag?”
zh: 你在塑料袋上留下指紋了嗎？」

en: “What bag?”
zh: 「什麼塑料袋？」

en: “The plastic bag you put the knife and towel in.”
zh: 「你用來裝刀和毛巾的塑料袋。」

en: Jerry’s hands start shaking and he looks out the side window. “They’ll be on it.”
zh: 傑瑞的手開始顫抖，他透過側窗向外凝望：「應該有吧。」

en: “It’s only a matter of time before they come for you anyway,” Hans says.
zh: 漢斯說：「反正他們會來找你，只不過是時間早晚的問題罷了。

en: “The longer you try and avoid them, the harder it’s going to go when they find you.”
zh: 你拖的時間越長，事情就越糟糕，他們終究會找到你的。」

en: “Then help me. Don’t let them pin every unsolved homicide over the last twenty years on me.”
zh: 「那你就幫幫我，不要讓他們把過去二十多年的殺人懸案都安到我頭上。」

en: “I’m sorry, Jerry. We have to go to the police.”
zh: 「對不起，傑瑞，我們必須去警局。」

en: “You think I’m guilty.”
zh: 「你認為我有罪？」

en: Hans doesn’t answer for a few seconds, then he looks down at his hands. “I’m sorry.”
zh: 漢斯沉默了幾秒鐘，然後低頭看著自己的手：「對不起。」

en: “If you think I’m guilty, then you owe me, because you killed Sandra.”
zh: 「如果你認為我有罪，那你就虧欠我了，因為你殺死了桑德拉。」

en: Hans says nothing. He gives Jerry a cold, hard stare.
zh: 漢斯沒吭聲，他冷冷地、兇狠地瞪了傑瑞一眼。

en: “You killed Sandra,” Jerry repeats.
zh: 「你殺了桑德拉。」傑瑞重複道，「如果我有罪，那麼你也難脫干係。」

en: “Don’t go there, Jerry.”
zh: 「不要胡說，傑瑞。」

en: “The night the florist died, if I killed her, then you should have gone to the police.
zh: 「花店老闆被殺的那天晚上，如果是我殺了她，那麼你應該去報警。

en: But you didn’t. And because you didn’t, I was able to kill Sandra.
zh: 但是你沒有，正因為你沒有，我才會動手殺了桑德拉。

en: If you’d taken me to the police then Sandra would still be alive.
zh: 如果你把我交給警察，桑德拉應該還會好好活著的。

en: But you didn’t.
zh: 但是你沒有。

en: And she’s dead. And that makes you an accomplice.”
zh: 她已經死了，而你是幫凶。」

en: “Jerry—” “You can’t have it both ways,” Jerry says. “I don’t think I did any of it, but if I did, then Sandra’s blood is on your hands for not doing the right thing. You have to live with that.
zh: 「傑瑞——」傑瑞說：「你不能什麼好處都佔了，我認為我沒有殺人，但如果是我乾的，那麼你手上也沾著桑德拉的血，因為你沒有採取正確的行動，你必須背負這種罪孽。

en: The only way to clear your conscience is to help me prove I’m innocent of everything.”
zh: 你想要無愧於心，唯一的方法是證明我的清白。」

en: “You don’t think that every single day I’m aware how my decision to help out my best friend led to her dying?
zh: 「難道我每一天都該戰戰兢兢，生怕我最好的朋友是因為我的決定才導致他妻子的死亡？」

en: Huh?” He punches the steering wheel. “You stupid moron.”
zh: 他猛地一拳砸向方向盤，「你這個愚蠢的白痴！」

en: Without any warning Jerry twists towards Hans and swings with his left arm. He punches his friend as hard as he can in the mouth, but the angles and the geometry of the enclosed car don’t give him as much leverage as he would like, making the punch less effective than he’d hoped. Hans’s head snaps to the side.
zh: 沒有發出任何警告，傑瑞扭身面對漢斯，揮起左臂，使出最大力氣用拳砸向他朋友的嘴部，但封閉車廂的角度和幾何形狀影響了他可以發揮的力道，這一拳打得不夠狠，漢斯的頭擺到一邊。

en: Before he can get a second shot in, Hans gets his arm inside of Jerry’s and hits him in the throat, not hard, but hard enough to struggle for his next breath and to start coughing.
zh: 還沒等他第二次出手，漢斯已經揮起手臂，一拳擊中了他的喉嚨，不夠狠，但足以讓他難受半天才喘過氣來。傑瑞咳嗽起來。

en: “What the hell, Jerry?” he asks.
zh: 「你究竟在搞什麼，傑瑞？」他問。

en: “It’s,” he says, gasping for breath, “your fault.
zh: 他喘著氣說：「這是……你的錯。是，你的，錯。」

en: “Shut up,” Hans says.
zh: 「閉嘴。」漢斯說。

en: “If you—”
zh: 「如果你——」

en: This time Hans reaches across and punches him in the arm. “I said shut up. I wish to God I had turned you in that night.”
zh: 這次換漢斯伸手對他的手臂猛擊一拳：「我說閉嘴，我真希望那天晚上我把你扭送到了警察局。」

en: Jerry wishes the same thing.
zh: 傑瑞也希望如此。

en: Sandra, Hans, Eva—they were meant to protect him.
zh: 桑德拉、漢斯、伊娃，他們都在有意保護著他。

en: They were his guardians, and now people are dead because of him.
zh: 他們是他的監護人，而現在人們死了，都是因為他。

en: If it’s true.
zh: 如果這些都是真的……

en: Which it can’t be.
zh: 但這些不可能是真的。

en: “Help me,” Jerry says. “I would never hurt anybody.”
zh: 傑瑞說：「幫幫我，我永遠不會傷害任何人。」

en: “You have to realize it’s not your fault,” Hans says. “None of it is. It’s this damn disease.
zh: 漢斯說：「你必須知道這並不是你的錯，都不是，都是這該死的病。

en: You’re a good guy, you’re not a killer. You’re not the Bag Man or even the bad man you think you are.
zh: 你是個好人，你不是殺人兇手，不是黑袋狂魔，甚至你也不是你自認為的惡徒。

en: I understand what you’re saying, about the blank check, but—”
zh: 我理解你所說的一切，有關那張空白支票的意思，但是——」

en: The cell phone Jerry took from the dead woman starts to ring.
zh: 忽然，傑瑞從死去的女人身上拿的手機響了。

en: He gets it out of his pocket and stares at it.
zh: 他從口袋裡掏了出來，盯著它看。

en: “Who is it?”
zh: 「是誰？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: “I don’t know. You’re the only one who has the number,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我不知道，只有你一個人知道我現在這個號碼。」

en: “Where did you get the phone?”
zh: 「手機是你從哪裡弄的？」

en: Hans says.
zh: 漢斯說。

en: “From the dead woman. But the SIM card is new, I got that from the mall.
zh: 「從那個死去的女人身上拿的，但電話卡是新的，我是從商場里買的。

en: Should I answer it?”
zh: 我要不要接？」

en: “Give it to me.”
zh: 「把它給我。」

en: Jerry hands him the phone. Hans answers the call and says hello then just listens.
zh: 傑瑞遞給他手機，漢斯接聽電話，說你好，接著只是在聽。

en: Jerry can hear talking on the other end but not enough to understand what is being said.
zh: 傑瑞可以聽到電話另一端的人在不斷說話，但聽不清，不知道在說些什麼。

en: After fifteen seconds Hans hangs up without saying anything. He hands the phone back.
zh: 十五秒鐘之後，漢斯一語不發地掛斷電話，把手機遞還給傑瑞。

en: “Who was it?” Jerry asks.
zh: 「是誰？」傑瑞問。

en: “Guy’s name doesn’t matter, buddy. Probably wasn’t his real name.
zh: 「名字並不重要，老兄，也可能不是他的真名。

en: Said he worked at lost and found at the mall. Said he found a package that he was pretty sure belonged to you.”
zh: 他說他是商場失物招領處的，他們發現了一個塑料袋，他肯定是你的。」

en: “Then why didn’t he call the police?”
zh: 「那麼他為什麼不報警？」

en: “That was the police, you idiot,” Hans says, then takes a deep breath.
zh: 「他就是警察，你這個白痴。」漢斯深呼吸了一口氣，「對不起，我不應該這樣說。

en: But it wasn’t lost and found, it was the police trying to get you to go back.”
zh: 不是失物招領處，而是警方想讓你回去。」

en: “But how?
zh: 「怎麼會呢？

en: How did they get my number?”
zh: 他們怎麼有我的電話號碼？」

en: “I don’t know.
zh: 「我不知道。

en: Wait . . . wait . . . you said you went into the bathroom to put the SIM card in, right?”
zh: 等等，你說你走進廁所，把電話卡裝進手機，對吧？」

en: “Right.”
“Because you just bought a new one,” Hans says.
zh: 「因為你剛剛買了一個新的電話卡？」漢斯說。

en: “Right.” “SIM cards come with the phone numbers written on the sides of the packet. Where’s the packet, Jerry?
zh: 「電話卡的電話號碼常寫在包裝袋的兩邊，包裝袋在哪兒，傑瑞？

en: Do you have it or did you leave it there?”
zh: 你是拿著還是把它落在那裡了？」

en: Jerry pats down his pockets and then searches the supermarket bag. “I must have left it in the bathroom.”
zh: 傑瑞拍了他的口袋，然後又在購物袋裡找了一通：「我一定是把它落在廁所里了。」

en: “Then that’s it.
zh: 漢斯說：「這就是了。

en: They’re already tightening the noose, Jerry. But there’s another option,” Hans says. “An option I can give you because you’re my friend.”
zh: 他們已經收緊了絞索，傑瑞，但還有另一種選擇，我可以給你指條明路，因為你是我的朋友。」

en: “What option?”
zh: 「什麼明路？」

en: “Take out the SIM card and switch off the phone.”
zh: 「取出電話卡，關掉手機。」

en: Jerry does as he’s told. Then he wipes the phone down with his shirt and tosses it out the window.
zh: 傑瑞按他說的做了，然後他擦了擦手機，把它扔到窗外。

en: “You didn’t need to do that.”
zh: 「你沒必要這樣做。」

en: “Well it’s done.
zh: 「好了，做完了。

en: Now what?” Jerry asks.
zh: 接下來怎麼辦？」傑瑞問。

en: “Now they’re going to run the surveillance footage of the mall looking for the guy who carried a package into the bathroom and left it there.
zh: 「現在，他們會調看商場監控錄像，尋找帶著塑料袋進入廁所、離開時忘在那裡的人。

en: Then they’re going to follow you out and watch you climb into my car.
zh: 他們將會看到你走出商場，爬上我的車。

en: Thankfully it’s a mall, not a bank—the footage of you climbing into the car is going to look like the kind of footage you see of Bigfoot.
zh: 慶幸的是，這裡是商場而不是銀行，你爬進車裡的錄像可能不夠清晰，顯得你像只大腳怪獸。

en: The prints will give them your name, only they’re not going to know where you are, but when they figure it out they’ll send an Armed Offenders Unit after us.”
zh: 通過指紋分析他們會知道你的名字，只是他們不會知道你在哪裡，但是等他們搞清楚之後，會派武裝警察分隊搜捕我們。」

en: “All that for a knife that got left behind?”
zh: 「這一切就是因為我落下的那把刀？」

en: “All this because the woman you don’t think you killed has just been found.”
zh: 他說著，調大了收音機的音量，「這一切都是因為他們發現了你自以為沒有殺害的那個女人。」
